message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This analysis utilizes data from the World Bank Enterprise Survey and the Global Competitiveness Index to investigate the relationship between firm competitiveness and corruption perceptions.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Survey", "Global Competitiveness Index"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We draw on data from the Integrated Public Use Microdata Series and the Panel Study of Income Dynamics to analyze long-term trends in intergenerational economic mobility in the United States.", "dataset": ["Integrated Public Use Microdata Series", "Panel Study of Income Dynamics"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "To examine the causal impact of education interventions, we use a randomized controlled trial dataset from a program providing technology-assisted tutoring to children in rural areas of Ghana.", "dataset": ["randomized controlled trial dataset"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "We explore the relationship between air pollution and heart rate variability using data from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey and the Environmental Protection Agency's Air Quality System database.", "dataset": ["National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey", "Environmental Protection Agency's Air Quality System database"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Using census and survey data, we estimate the effects of rural road construction on smallholder farmers' agricultural productivity and income in Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["census data", "survey data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from the Living Standards Measurement Study and the Demographic and Health Surveys to analyze the determinants of stunting among young children in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study", "Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "This study employs both primary and secondary data sources, including the 2018 Kenya Financial Access Survey and the Kenya Integrated Household Budget Survey, to examine the impact of financial inclusion on household welfare in Kenya.", "dataset": ["2018 Kenya Financial Access Survey", "Kenya Integrated Household Budget Survey"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the Indian Human Development Survey and the National Family Health Survey to investigate the association between women's education and empowerment and child health outcomes in India.", "dataset": ["Indian Human Development Survey", "National Family Health Survey"], "topic": ["Gender", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "To assess the effectiveness of a cash transfer program in reducing poverty and inequality, we use panel data from the Brazilian Cadastro Único program and the Permanent Household Survey.", "dataset": ["Brazilian Cadastro Único program", "Permanent Household Survey"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using cross-national data from the World Values Survey and the Afrobarometer, we examine the relationship between trust in government and the provision of basic services, such as health care and education, in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "Afrobarometer"], "topic": ["Governance"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "This analysis utilizes data from the World Bank Enterprise Survey and the Global Competitiveness Index to investigate the relationship between firm competitiveness and corruption perceptions.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Survey", "Global Competitiveness Index"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We draw on data from the Integrated Public Use Microdata Series and the Panel Study of Income Dynamics to analyze long-term trends in intergenerational economic mobility in the United States.", "dataset": ["Integrated Public Use Microdata Series", "Panel Study of Income Dynamics"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "To examine the causal impact of education interventions, we use a randomized controlled trial dataset from a program providing technology-assisted tutoring to children in rural areas of Ghana.", "dataset": ["randomized controlled trial dataset"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "We explore the relationship between air pollution and heart rate variability using data from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey and the Environmental Protection Agency's Air Quality System database.", "dataset": ["National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey", "Environmental Protection Agency's Air Quality System database"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Using census and survey data, we estimate the effects of rural road construction on smallholder farmers' agricultural productivity and income in Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["census data", "survey data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from the Living Standards Measurement Study and the Demographic and Health Surveys to analyze the determinants of stunting among young children in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study", "Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "This study employs both primary and secondary data sources, including the 2018 Kenya Financial Access Survey and the Kenya Integrated Household Budget Survey, to examine the impact of financial inclusion on household welfare in Kenya.", "dataset": ["2018 Kenya Financial Access Survey", "Kenya Integrated Household Budget Survey"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the Indian Human Development Survey and the National Family Health Survey to investigate the association between women's education and empowerment and child health outcomes in India.", "dataset": ["Indian Human Development Survey", "National Family Health Survey"], "topic": ["Gender", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "To assess the effectiveness of a cash transfer program in reducing poverty and inequality, we use panel data from the Brazilian Cadastro Único program and the Permanent Household Survey.", "dataset": ["Brazilian Cadastro Único program", "Permanent Household Survey"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using cross-national data from the World Values Survey and the Afrobarometer, we examine the relationship between trust in government and the provision of basic services, such as health care and education, in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "Afrobarometer"], "topic": ["Governance"]}]
